question.Q: Do you have a sore throat?
Could you have swallowed something (such as a fish bone)?
See a doctor immediately. Something may be lodged in your throat.
Does food seem to stick high up in your chest after you swallow it?
Do you sometimes experience pain in your chest, particularly when you squat, bend, or lie down?
See your doctor. Your esophagus may be scarred as a result of acid reflux.
Are you having difficulty swallowing, do you regurgitate food you swallow, and have you lost a lot of weight in a short time (more than 10 pounds in 10 weeks)?

See a doctor immediately. You may have a disorder of the esophagus such as ACHALASIA or a PHARYNGEAL POUCH, or you may have a scarred esophagus from chronic acid reflux. There is also a possibility that you have CANCER THE ESOPHAGUS, especially if you are over 40.
Do you swallow normally but feel a lump in your throat when you swallow or feel that the food will not go down?
See your doctor. Your swallowing problem may be a symptom of ANXIETY. Or it may be a symptom of GASTROESOPHAGEAL REFLUX DISEASE.
See your doctor if you are unable to make a diagnosis from this chat.
